item.title: How many `&` or `|` ?
item.description: Recently, I reviewed a paper that introduces a package, so I reviewed the code and noticed that the authors often used && (and) and || (or) whereas only & and | were required. I guess this is due to: other programming language; the fact that for vectors of one element in R & and && are equivalent (same for | and ||). Regarding point 1, we could take C as an example.
